message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education. I'm playing the role of a primary or secondary school teacher from Hungary. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements using the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a Hungarian teacher's perspective:

TT4G35A - AI helps write/improve lesson plans: This is a positive use case that many teachers would likely agree with. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35B - AI enables adapting material to different abilities: This is also a positive capability. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35C - AI assists in supporting students individually: This is a positive aspect. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is a positive use. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35E - AI automates administrative tasks: Most teachers would appreciate this. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent work: This is a negative/risk statement. I'll say "Agree" (it's true that this is a risk)

TT4G35G - AI makes inappropriate recommendations: This is a risk statement. I'll say "Agree" (this is a valid concern)

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases: This is a risk statement. I'll say "Agree" (this is a valid concern)

TT4G35I - AI jeopardises privacy/security: This is a risk statement. I'll say "Agree" (this is a valid concern)

TT4G35J - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogy: This is a risk statement. I'll say "Agree" (this is a valid concern)

I'll provide a balanced set of responses, showing agreement with both the positive uses and the legitimate concerns about AI in education.
